titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Louis Paul Lochner collection, 1933-1946
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-11-17T09:28-0800

change.item: Revised by Paige Minister to reflect refoldering and to remove items that have been transferred to library.
Revised to add PDF file of box 1 inventory.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Elizabeth Phillips.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Louis Paul Lochner Collection)//EN" "lochnelp.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, reports, and printed matter relating to the Nazi party, domestic conditions in Germany and German foreign policy before and during World War II, post-war occupation of Germany, denazification efforts, and communist party activities in Germany. Includes correspondence of Joachim von Ribbentrop.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Louis Paul Lochner Collection, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: American political activist, journalist, and author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, reports, and printed matter relating to the Nazi party, domestic conditions in Germany and German foreign policy before and during World War II, post-war occupation of Germany, denazification efforts, and communist party activities in Germany. Includes correspondence of Joachim von Ribbentrop.
The individual folder titles are Lochner's.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials Note
separatedmaterial.p: Some items have been transferred to the Hoover Institution Library or incorporated into the following collections:

Franz von Papen miscellaneous papers, Hoover Institution Archives
Benno Reifenberg typescript, Hoover Institution Archives
Hellmuth Wissmann writings, Hoover Institution Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written by Lochner, contains his own descriptions of the materials found in the collection along with his opinion of their significance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Hitler and Hitler's Adjutants, etc. (originals and carbons) regarding German-British relations. Includes newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handwritten note explaining the provenance of these papers, as well as copies of original folders with notes by Herbert Hoover and Agnes Peterson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also included in the correspondent files are letters from Ribbentrop's office staff (Abetz, Bottiger, Falke, von Raumer, Rodde, and Thorner).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter to Ribbentrop re problems of authority in German-British relations. Carbon copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Report from Rome on a meeting with Suvich. Telegram.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Re Daniel Vincent. Telegram.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains Ribbentrop correspondence only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph in pencil re Sir Ruthermere's visit to Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph in black ink with attached translation of letter by A. L. Kennedy to Ribbentrop re his article in the Times.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram re Genfsitzung.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Signed typescript re Lord Allen of Hurthwood's visit to Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph with attached "Entwurf eines Briefes des Reichsaussenministers an den Staatssekretar des Ausseren Sir John Simon, London, Foreign Office."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Signed typescript re visit of British soldiers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Signed typescript re Ribbentrop's nomination as German ambassador to London. Includes two notes for the press and note by [Constantin] Freiherr von Neurath.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript re limitation of naval forces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes reports, translations of letters and articles from the foreign press, notes for Hitler (Notizen für den Kanzler), telephone conversation transcripts, etc., arranged in chronological order, signed or with written notes by Ribbentrop. Typescripts unless otherwise noted. The documents often explicitly mention Hitler as the addressee. If the documents carry a title, these are given in German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Not signed by Joachim von Ribbentrop. Includes DNB (Deutsches Nachrichtenburo) press reports, as well as undated documents.

did.unittitle: "Besprechung mit dem baskischen Abgeordneten Ybornegeray und Herrn Pirroneau, massgebender Mann beim Echo de Paris bei Brinon in dessen Wohnung,"
"Material für den Kanzler" re French and English press,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph.

did.unittitle: "Unterredung eines Freundes von mir mit dem englischen Konig,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Re meetings with British statesmen that lead to more friendly German-British relations.

did.unittitle: "Besprechung zwischen Monsieur Dupuy, Herrn de Brinon und mir,"
"Notizen für den Kanzler" re Great Britain and France,
"Notizen für den Kanzler" re meeting with von Neurath,
Re Hitler's meeting with Eden and re Ribbentrop's role as Hitler's confidant in questions of foreign policy,
"Notiz für den Kanzler" re trip to Paris and "Allgemeine Eindrucke in Frankreich,"
"Besprechung mit Herrn Louis Barthou, franzosischem Aussenminister,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Signed holograph note attached.

did.unittitle: "Notiz für den Kanzler" re France and Austria,
Re meeting with Sir Eric Phipps,
"Notiz für den Kanzler über englische Reise,"
"Besprechungen der franzosischen Frontkampferfuhrer mit Vertretern ihrer Regierung im Anschluss Berliner Reise 2-3 November 1934,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Translation of a letter by George Chichester to von Ribbentrop.

did.unittitle: "Zusamnenfassender Bericht uber die deutschfanzosische Frontkampferaktion von Winter 1933/1934 bis Jahresende 1934,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written by Abetz, signed by Ribbentrop.

did.unittitle: "Auszug aus einem Interview, das Jean Goy der Wochenschrift Notre Temps am 5.1.1935 gab,"
"Ubersetzung aus der Times vom 5.1.1935" re Eden,
"Einige in den letzten Tagen vom Ausland erhaltene Nachrichten," and "Notiz für den Führer und Reichskanzler,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Re an important article by A.L. Kennedy (Times).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes six articles from the foreign press.

did.unittitle: "Betrifft Londoner Reise zwecks Forderung deutsch-englischer Wirtschafts-beziehungen. Entsendung einer offiziellen Goodwill Commission nach Deutschland...,"
"Brief von Lord Lothian," and "Vertrauliche Ausserungen von Lord Lothian uber Gegensatze in Berlin,"
"Notiz für den Führer" re tactical areas,
"Notiz für den Kanzler. Italienische Verstandigungspropaganda in Frankreich,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Re foreign relations with France and England.

did.unittitle: "Notiz für den Führer. Betrifft englischen Frontkampferbesuch,"
"Betrifft Herrn von Stohrer, Herrn von Keller, Pg. Reinebeck,"
"Notiz für den Führer Betr. Reichsbankprasident Schacht,"
Translation of letter by Londonderry to von Ribbentrop,
Re Ribbentrop's and Dieckhoff's handing over a German document to Eden,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sent as telegram from London to Berlin. The document was titled "grosser konstruktiver Friedensplan" and was handed over in the presence of Lord Halifax and Mr. Wigram.

did.unittitle: Re instructions to Furst Bismarck in London,
Re visit of Sir Oswald Mosley,
Re visit of Graf Bonmartini, owner of Giornale d'Italia,
Translation of letter by Londonderry to von Ribbentrop,
"Betrifft Besuch Sir Oswald Mosley beim Führer,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of Ribbentrop's letter to German ambassador to Italy von Hassel.

did.unittitle: "Notiz für den Führer Beiliegend einte korrespondenz mit Lord Londonderry,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter from Hitler to Franz von Papen nominating him ambassador to Austria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report on a car accident in which Ribbentrop was involved; three letters of congratulation on Ribbentrop's birthday from Hitler, Bruckner, and Schaub; and a letter from Richard Ribbentrop thanking Hitler for a Christmas gift.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter from Staatssekretar Otto Meissner to Julius Schaub.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lochner's translations of documents and telegrams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Based on documents found in the German Foreign Office. Contains information on German-Russian relations from 1922 to June 24, 1941.

did.unittitle: "Accord on Spoils Cited by Germans," Times,
Nine letters from Count Potocki to Polish Minister of Foreign Affairs,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report of a meeting with Hitler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter from a member of resistance to Brauchitsch.

did.unittitle: Church - in Germany prior to WWII,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of documents drawn up by Keitel and Ribbentrop.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Re conditions in Germany during and after WWII.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a history and interpretation of certain paragraphs of the law.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of a letter to Mrs. Goerdeler in commemoration of her husband's death.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A well-known publicist. Contains his thoughts about Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leading German industrialist. Contains excerpts from a letter to Lochner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes requests, thank yous, and other personal documents.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous requests to Occupation Forces in Germany,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains reports from East German provinces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a typescript re the reconstruction of press in post-Hitler Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes information about their hardship and appeals for help.

did.unittitle: Relief work of churches in Germany after WWII,
Reports from West Germany after WWII,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of a letter to Mrs. Rommel regarding the erection of a monument honoring Rommel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains documents re the events in Koenigsberg since April 9, 1945, including a partial list of persons arrested.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a bound typewritten manuscript, "Aber von innen gesehen...," which details Schroder's experiences and some events during the Third Reich.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains typescripts, an article, and a report written right after the German collapse and in the years following. Includes a typescript by Dr. Piening.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a typescript discussing his position regarding Hitler prior to WWII and his arrest in connection with the July 20, 1944 Hitler assassination attempt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a review of book by Grigore Gragencu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an appeal describing Wulle's experiences under the Nazi Party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter to Lochner with a list of 126 persons executed by the Nazis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains leaflets, newsletters, news clippings, and other printed matter. Includes a copy of the publication Hitler: Doomed to Die.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains articles, magazines, pamphlet, newspaper clippings, and other printed matter mainly regarding Nazi Germany. Includes a copy of the speech "Erfahrungen in Russland und Folgerung für die sozial-politsche Aufgabe der Christen im Westen" by H. Gollwitzer given on March 26, 1953, a memo titled "Denkschrift über die gegenwärtigen Probleme der Entnazifizierung," and the book Wir Kriegsblinden und Unsere Gemeinschaft 1916-1956.

did.unittitle: Excerpts from Weekly Political Intelligence and German Opinion Review,
Resolution by all political parties represented in the Provisional Parliament of Great Hesse,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Objects to the manner in which houses were being requisitioned for occupation troops.

did.unittitle: Documents re the sufferings and migrations of German Expelles from Silesia and the Sudetenland,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The papers were contributed by the Office of the Catholic Monsigneur Albert Buttner, who conducted a Kirchliche Hilfsstelle in Frankfurt, Germany and include eye-witness accounts of the migrations, mainly in German. Includes the typescript "The Czech Conquest of Saaz, Sudetengau."

did.unittitle: A Check List of Current Serials in the United States Zone of Germany,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Prepared by the Library of Congress Mission HQ, U S. Forces, European Theater, APO 757, U.S. Army.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Discusses how the Soviets tried to make the other parties in the town of Parchim, Mechlemberg in Germany come into the communist fold. Contributed by Gerd Niehoff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A humorous mimeographed monthly paper published by the staff personnel of the 2nd German Infantry Regiment stationed at Munster.

did.unittitle: Case history of a complaint and its disposition by Dr. Clemens Kauffmann,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Kauffmann was an appointed health officer of the Berlin section of Lichterfelde. The complaint regards Kauffmann's ejection from his home after being assured that it would not be requisitioned upon assuming his post as a health officer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Submitted by Dr. Noll Von Nahmer, a ministerial director in the Reich Ministry of Finance.

did.unittitle: Project for a periodic correspondence letter,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Submitted by Dr. Theordore Beuchner, a German journalist. Includes material in German with Buechner's English translations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of an article supplied to the students of the English Seminary of Berlin University, which was then located in the Russian sector of the city. The article contains criticisms of the Britain and the United States.

did.unittitle: Case history of Dr. Rudolf Pander,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a request by Palmer in English for better treatment as a prisoner of war. Also includes a letter to Lochner in German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A typescript copy of an article written by a German prisoner of war in Egypt. This soldier tries to make clear to the youth of Germany how wrong the ideologies which they followed were. He discusses constructing "The Bridge" toward establishing a New Germany which shall lead Germany back into the family of nations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an eye-witness account of the disaster by Prof. Dr. Hermann Luedke, a native of Wurzburg until 1946, when he was appointed chief of all the city hospitals in Schweinfurt and health officer for the district.

did.unittitle: Abraham Lincoln, play by Dr. Hermann Leudke,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes a copy of a letter by Leudke.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of a letter in German written by Ruth Fischer. The letter was screened by Germany's Civil Censorship Division at Offenbach and was deemed important enough that a copy of it was made for intelligence purposes. In it the writer outlines a Soviet Russian plot for turning Germany into a Bolshevik State.

did.unittitle: Exposé on the future of the German press,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written at the request of the German government by Dr. Hermann Katzengerger, former press-officer in the German Foreign Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter written by General Clay stating that he is unwilling to pass along a petition to President Truman, written by a group of Catholic bishops assembled in Fulda, Germany, asking that assistance be given to expellees from Eastern Germany to ease their suffering.

did.unittitle: Story of the surrender of the city of Heidenheim by Hans Voith,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript in German describing how the citizens of the Suabian city of Heidenheim outwitted the Nazis who had intended to bomb the city. Given to Lochner by a Stuttgart military intelligence officer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains documents from intelligence officers in Berlin which discuss the daily disagreements between American and Russian authorities in Berlin.

did.unittitle: Speech ascribed to Cardinal von Galen,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of a speech in German that circulated widely among Catholics with the claim that it was delivered in Rome by Cardinal von Galen in March 1946. It aims to provoke suspicion in the occupation authorities.

did.unittitle: Protocols of the first two sessions of the provisional people's parliament for Wurtemberg-Baden,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two copies of "Verhandlungen der Vorläufigen Volksvertretung für Württemberg-Baden."

did.unittitle: Sidelights on the German Communist Party,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a typescript in German regarding the Communist Party's demand for land reform as well as their objection to the writing of constitutions for the three sections of Germany and to occupation by American troops on the grounds that it would prevent German unity. Also includes a summary of Soviet tactics in Berlin and their dealings with the Democratic parties.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report by Lord Mayor Klett on one year of occupation and reconstruction; a special edition of Rhine Neckar Zeitung showing the results of the election of delegates to the provisional parliament of Wurtemburg-Baden; an edition of Stuttgart Zeitung; three copies of an open letter to Dr. Schumacher, leader of the Social-Democrats; and a copy of the speech Für Frieden, Freiheit, und Sozialismus (Peace, Freedom, and Socialism) by Dr. Kurt Schumacher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A copy of a stock card sent to the families of fallen German soldiers.

did.unittitle: Economic news on the Soviet Union,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a German report.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photographic copies of artwork by German artist Erich Martin, an opponent of Nazism. Also includes a typescript copy of Martin's description of the work as well as a handwritten explanation of the significance of each photo written by H. Hartel, an American censor at Offenbach who contributed the contents of this file to Lochner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Various documents collected by H. Hartel consisting of election flyers for the Kassel district and election programs from a new party, the National-Democrats, and the Democratic Peoples' Party. It also contains a list of all the former Nazi Party members in Wiess-Baden; a speech by Dr. Wagembach of Giessen; a speech by the Social-Democratic leader for Greater Hesse, Wilhelm Knowthe; and a pamphlet, "Questions and Answers," by Anton Ackermann on the alleged necessity for a union of the Communists and Social-Democrats. Finally, it contains excerpts from letters by refugees that went through the censorship as well as a few poems written under the impact of expulsion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents in German related to the feeding of the Germans, especially Catholics, ejected from the Sudeten area of Czechoslovakia.

did.unittitle: Copy of letter by the sub-prefect of the French Zone at Freiburg,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Informs all the German political parties that in election speeches there must be no mention of a German central government, of the internationization of the Ruhr and Rhineland, and of the economic junction of the Saar to France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A collection of Austrian denazification laws supplied by the principal denazification officer for American Military Government in Austria, Mr. M. Wallach.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains government orders, posters, graphs, a British questionnaire (Fragebogen), directives, a registration blank (Meldebogen), and two monthly denazification reports. Also included is a "Note on Denazification in the Hansestadt Hamburg," a copy of a letter by Franz Karl Maier charging the Prime Minister of Wuerttemberg-Baden with collaborating with the Nazis, a request for the denazification minister, a Dr. Kamm, to rule on his objections to certain phases of denazification, and a plan for changing the Law for Liberation from National Socialism and Militarism.

did.unittitle: Political pamphlets and documents from Wurttemberg-Baden,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Handbills and appeals issued during the 1936 election campaigns.

did.unittitle: Program and other details of the First Convention of the Federation of Trade Unions of Wurttemberg-Baden,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This convention was held August 30-September 1 of 1946 at Kornwestheim near Stuttgart.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an indictment against a man from Stuttgart named Richard Schmid, who was accused of complicity in a treasonable plot.

did.unittitle: "Requests of the Laenderrat to Military Government,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A report detailing the decisions and results of the Laenderrat meeting in Stuttgart.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains documents indicating the problems of the capital of Wurttemberg-Baden, Stuttgart.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a document explaining the Regional Government Coordinating Office in the American Zone, as well as biographical material concerning various German officials in the American Zone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a report by a health officer to the American military in Wurttemberg-Baden, indicating an increase in various epidemics, especially diphtheria.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A copy of the by-laws of a club for young Germans and Americans, formed under American auspices. In German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains various writings in English and German by Dill, who described herself as an authoress of Bad Durkeim in the French Zone.

did.unittitle: Law for making farmland available for settlement in the American Zone,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In German.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two copies of the issue for December-January, 1946-47.

did.unittitle: Typescript by A. von Megulnoff, Berlin,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript titled "Gefahr für den Welfrieden" (Danger to World Peace) describing an antibolshevik Russian living in exile in Berlin.

did.unittitle: "Die Existenzmoglichkeit Deutschlands in Beziehung zur Festlegung seiner Grenzen" (The Possibilities for Existence for Germany as Related to the Fixation of Her Boundaries),

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two copies of a document written by Dr. Grimm, former executive director of the Chamber of Commerce of Hirschberg, Silesia. Dr. Grimm seeks to prove that the eastern boundaries of Germany as then interpreted by Russia and Poland will mean a catastrophe. Contributed by A. von Megulnoff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Describes developments in the Russian Zone concerning land reform, provisioning of greater Berlin, and the deportation of German skilled workers. Contributed by Rev. Jochen Wilde, a Lutheran pastor who opposed Hitler and communism.

did.unittitle: Photostat of typical Russian Secret Service (NKVD) passport,
Proceedings of the Social Democratic Party Convention at Hanover,
Papers submitted by Prince Louis Ferdinand of Prussia,
Article by Max Schnitzer on the Hoover War Library,
Die Ernaehrung des Deutschen Volkes (The Nutrition of the German People) by Dr. Wilhelm Ziegelmayer,
Karl Brammer, "So lebten sie: 700 Milliarden Schulden,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two typescripts: "Die Akademie für die Rechte der Völker und die Freiheit der Wissenschaft" and "The History of the Academy for the Rights of Nations."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains four typescripts: "Zeitliches," "Die grosse Enttäuschung," "Der Bannstrahl," and "Auf falschen Wegen."

did.unittitle: Clemens Lammers, "Reichsverband der Deutschen Industrie und Machtergreifung,"
Cornelia and Uta Maass, letter to Adolf Hitler,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A plea for Hermann Maass who was sentenced to death for his part in the attempt on Hitler's life at Potsdam.

did.unittitle: Eva Maass, letter to Otto Thierack, Minister of Justice,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sent on behalf of Hermann Maass who was sentenced to death for his part in the attempt on Hitler's life at Potsdam.

did.unittitle: Hermann Maass, letter to his wife,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written shortly before Maass' execution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains "Seven Documents Relating to the Operation of the Interradio A. G.," a letter addressed to General Mark Clark requesting the speedy investigation of internees in Walchsee, and "Teilabschrift aus Briefen an österreichische Regierungsmitglieder und an österreichische Nationalräte."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains "Mein Tagebuch," "Meine politischen Tagebuch-Blätter," and "Meine Confessio Vitae" (My Confession of My Life)."

did.unittitle: Horst Pelskmann, "Plaidoyer fuer die 'SS' Schutzstaffel der NSDAP gehalten vor dem Internationalen Militaergerichtshof, Nürnberg,"
Ernst Poensgen, "Hitler und die Ruhrindustriellen: ein Rückblick,"
Albert Wolf, "Der Weg in den Abgrund" (The Road into the Abyss),
